thread.title: After technical glitch, Southwest Airlines flights delayed at Portland International Airport
thread.title_full: After technical glitch, Southwest Airlines flights delayed at Portland International Airport | OregonLive.com

author: Michael Russell | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: After technical glitch, Southwest Airlines flights delayed at Portland International Airport
text:
A technical glitch that caused massive delays on Southwest Airlines flights across the United States appears to have slowed flights in Portland as well.
The unexplained issue forced airline employees to check in some passengers manually, causing long lines across the nation. According to the airline, the ongoing problem caused more than 450 flights to be delayed.
As of 7 p.m., nine of Sunday's 15 remaining Southwest flights inbound or outbound from Portland International Airport were delayed. Two arrivals were pushed back by more than an hour.
After a 2014 collapse , Southwest's overall on-time performance has improved, ranking first among all airlines in September with 87.5 percent of flights arriving or departing on time.
A Portland of Portland spokesperson referred inquiries to Southwest Airlines. The Dallas-based company did not immediately return a call for comment.
In a statement , Southwest asked passengers traveling Sunday or Monday to arrive at least two hours early for departures, print out boarding passes in advance and use airport kiosks to print passes and luggage tags.
-- Michael Russell Follow @tdmrussell
